answers.author: Thomas Quist
answers.text:
Hi Phil,
I'm not exactly sure what you are looking for.  Are you looking comparative data or some literature on performance measurement?  On the home page, hover over priorities, and then select "performance management" to start learning about the ICMA Center for Performance Measurement (CPM).  I hope this helps!

answers.author: Zane Reynolds
answers.text:
Phil, 
The FY2009 Comapartive Performance Measurement Report can be found at icma.org/cpm. This document is a premium service available to members of the Center for Performance Measurement only. 
For more information on how to join CPM, non-members can visit icma.org/performance.


Phil,

answers.author: Donald Gloo
answers.text:
As Zane Reynolds correctly noted, the annual data report from the Center for Performance Measurement is a product that is available to CPM members as part of their annual subscription fee.
Jurisdictions that are not enrolled in CPM may purchase a copy of the annual data report through the ICMA bookstore.  For example, the 2008 report can be found here:  http://bookstore.icma.org/product1.cfm?Product_ID=2004.  (The 2009 report will go to the printer in the next few weeks.)

Phil Sutton

title: Comparative Performance Measurement
